meanings.definition: To interpret or present in terms of history.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys historicizing old photographs to learn about the past.
meanings.sent2: The historian is historicizing the ancient artifacts found in the excavation site.
meanings.sent3: By historicizing the family recipe, she discovered it dated back to the 1800s.
meanings.sent4: The novel historicizes the events of the war, bringing them to life for readers.
meanings.sent5: Historicizing the traditions of the tribe made their culture more understandable.

meanings.definition: To place in a historical context.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator is historicizing the newly acquired painting.
meanings.sent2: When studying literature, it is important to historicize the works to understand their significance.
meanings.sent3: The chef historicized the origins of the dish, adding a fun twist to the menu.
meanings.sent4: By historicizing the building, the architect was able to preserve its historical charm.
meanings.sent5: Historicizing the battle allowed students to grasp its impact on the region.
